title: Starbucks Unveils $1B Restructuring, to Close 1% of Stores, Lay Off 900
snippets: The coffee giant plans to cut 900 corporate jobs and shut down about 1% of its stores as the chain's turnaround plan approaches a one-year mark.
The coffee chain is restructuring to save money by closing its worst performing stores.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMifkFVX3lxTE1WeUNnZ0xCQ3d2cGI5Zk5HbTI3VlhfWlFfMndWVmpDUWp5dTBfT25sNDI1TlVpSnlNclh0ZkdkZEdqU09teC1ad3NGVjBSVHI0TWdIbDhEVlozVnA2a3hYQU00c1F1RGlUbWpLVWFmeXJSZU9fdnhBYzM3XzBwdw?oc=5" target="_blank">Starbucks to close stores, cut 900 jobs in $1B restructur
Coffee giant Starbucks will lay off workers and close stores as part of a $1 billion restructuring plan, CEO Brian Niccol said in a memo to employees on Thursday.
Starbucks announced a $1 billion restructuring plan Thursday that involves closing some of its North American coffeehouses and laying off about 900 workers.

Restructuring comes after six quarters of falling sales and growing pressure from unions over working conditions

Starbucks will lay off around 900 staff and pull down the shutters on some 100 cafes across North America as part of
The company will also renovate more than 1,000 stores over the next year, CEO Brian Niccol said.
Starbucks on Thursday announced it would close 1% of its corporately owned stores in North America, and lay off 900 non-retail staff.
titles: Starbucks is closing more stores and laying off 900 workers
Starbucks to close some US and UK stores
Starbucks to close stores, cut 900 jobs in $1B restructuring - Axios
Starbucks to lay off hundreds of workers, close stores in North America
Starbucks to close stores, lay off workers in $1 billion restructuring plan
Starbucks to cut 900 jobs and close dozens of North American stores as sales struggle
Starbucks Will Close Stores And Cut 900 Jobs In $1 Billion Restructuring
Starbucks to close some North American stores, lay off 900 non-retail employees
summary: Starbucks announced a $1 billion restructuring plan, which includes closing 1% of its North American corporately owned stores and laying off 900 non-retail staff. This move is part of a turnaround strategy led by new CEO Brian Niccol.

title: Amazon Pays $2.5B to Settle FTC Lawsuit on Prime Enrollment Practices
snippets: Federal regulators say Amazon has settled their lawsuit over whether its web designs have manipulated millions of people into paying for Prime subscriptions that were purposefully hard to cancel.

FTC said company enrolled millions of customers into its service without consent and made it difficult to cancel

Amazon has agreed to pay $2.5bn in fines and redress to Prime subscribers to settle a lawsuit by the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC), which accused the retail giant of signing

Amazon has agreed to pay $2.5 billion to settle a lawsuit from the Federal Trade Commission, which claimed it tricked millions of customers into subscribing to Prime and made it hard to cancel. Under the agreement, Amazon will pay a $1 billion civil penalty, along with $1.5 billion that it will pay
titles: Amazon agrees to settle U.S. lawsuit that it 'tricked' people into Prime
Amazon to pay $2.5bn to settle lawsuit over its Prime subscription service
Amazon will pay $2.5 billion to settle the FTC’s Prime lawsuit
summary: Amazon has settled a lawsuit with the Federal Trade Commission for $2.5 billion over accusations of enrolling customers into Prime without consent and making cancellation difficult. The settlement includes a $1 billion civil penalty and $1.5 billion for redress to affected Prime subscribers.

title: White House Warns of Mass Firings if Government Shuts Down
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiiwFBVV95cUxQYU10ZHRhYVBMbWtpOW53UzJPc1dwY2dIMUZWT0RJZlNUSV9VSnRUVlM2NG5jZWdIYlNmUlNyTFVHRzhSTDdiRk80OWx6ZGthOG5nMkJyMVJKX3ItR1BXTU52OU9qaVdpcHVlenA4d1dvWmFCX2VheWpER1RSTWxrRWZRMjN6N0pfaHNr?oc=5" target="_blank">White House threatens mass firings if g
The warning could ratchet up pressure on Congress to strike a deal to avert a government shutdown.

Democrats accuse Trump of intimidation tactics after memo outlines much more aggressive step than previous shutdowns

The White House is telling federal agencies to prepare large-scale firings of workers if the
The Trump administration is signaling that a government shutdown on Wednesday could lead to more firings. Democrats say its an intimidation tactic.
titles: White House threatens mass firings if government shuts down - Axios
Trump OMB orders preparation for mass firings of federal workers if government shuts down
White House tells agencies to prepare for firings if government shuts down
Trump administration signals more mass firings of federal workers if government shuts down
summary: The White House has warned of mass firings in the event of a government shutdown, pressuring Congress to reach a deal. This move, criticized by Democrats as an intimidation tactic, marks a more aggressive approach than previous shutdowns.

title: UK PM Plans Stricter Measures on Irregular Migrants to Curb Illegal Work
snippets: The prime minister believes a new scheme would help crack down on illegal working in the UK.
Plans to toughen measures against irregular migrants come despite concerns over civil liberties

Measure could be announced as soon as Friday as government looks for ways to tackle illegal immigration to the UK

  • UK politics – latest updates
titles: Digital ID cards to be compulsory for all UK adults under government plans
Starmer set to announce digital ID cards for all UK adults
Keir Starmer expected to announce plans for digital ID cards
summary: The UK Prime Minister is considering a new scheme aimed at reducing illegal working by introducing stricter measures against irregular migrants. This proposal, which has raised concerns regarding civil liberties, could be officially announced by Friday as part of the government's efforts to address illegal immigration in the UK.

title: Biden's Portrait on Trump's Wall Replaced with 'Autopen' Signed Photo

title: Sarkozy Convicted of Taking Gaddafi Funds, Sentenced to 5 Years
snippets: Nicolas Sarkozy, president from 2007-12, was found guilty of criminal conspiracy but cleared of other charges.
Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy has been jailed for 5 years after being found guilty of criminal conspiracy.
Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was convicted and sentenced to five years in prison on some charges in a case tied to the late Libyan dictator Moammar Gadhafi.
titles: Former French president Sarkozy given five-year sentence after Libya case
Ex-French president Sarkozy gets 5-year jail term
Paris court convicts former French President Sarkozy of criminal conspiracy in Libya trial
summary: Nicolas Sarkozy, the former French president, was convicted by a Paris criminal court of criminal conspiracy for accepting millions of euros in campaign funds from the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi. He was sentenced to five years in prison and will remain in custody even if he appeals. Sarkozy has consistently denied the charges.

title: Drones Disrupt Danish Airports; Minister Suggests Hybrid Attack
snippets: But the defence minister says there is no evidence of Russian involvement after the latest incident.

Drones recently spotted over several Danish airports including Aalborg were part of a hybrid attack that Danish Defense Minister Troels Lund Poulsen has said was likely orchestrated by a professional actor.

Drones overfly four more airports forcing Aalborg to halt traffic two nights after shutdown at Copenhagen terminals

  • Europe – live updates

    <
titles: Denmark says 'professional actor' behind drone incursions over its airports
Drone incursions in Denmark were 'hybrid attack' by 'professional actor,' justice minister says
‘Professional actor’ behind attacks that closed Danish airports, defence minister says
summary: Drones caused disruptions at several Danish airports, including a temporary shutdown of Aalborg Airport. Danish Defense Minister Troels Lund Poulsen suggested a professional actor likely orchestrated these incidents as part of a hybrid attack. However, there is no evidence to suggest Russian involvement in the latest drone sightings.

title: Super Typhoon Ragasa Kills 21, Causes Widespread Damage in Asia
snippets: Southern China evacuates millions as Ragasa unleashes devastating floods, disrupting lives and critical infrastructure.
One million residents of Guangdong, in southern China, were evacuated before the powerful storm made landfall on Wednesday. At least 18 people have been killed along its path this week.
Hundreds of firefighters and soldiers dispatched to Guangfu have gone door to door to check for trapped residents.

Huge clear-up efforts start after storm leaves trail of destruction, with 25 reported dead in Taiwan and the Philippines

Huge clear-up operations were under way in southern China and Hong Kong on Thursday, after
titles: Super Typhoon Ragasa leaves devastation across China, Taiwan, Philippines
Typhoon Ragasa Slams Into China After Deaths in Taiwan and the Philippines
Typhoon Ragasa Tears Through a Taiwan Town, Killing 14
Weakened Super Typhoon Ragasa heads towards Vietnam after battering China and Hong Kong
summary: Super Typhoon Ragasa caused deadly destruction across Asia, including Taiwan, the Philippines, and southern China. In Taiwan, at least 17 people were killed due to landslides and floods. Nearly 2 million people were evacuated in Guangdong, China, in anticipation of the storm, which also led to the closure of businesses and schools. The typhoon, described as the world's strongest this year, has resulted in at least 21 deaths along its path.

title: Cal Raleigh Hits 59th Home Run, Nears AL Season Record
snippets: Mariners slugger Cal Raleigh is two shy of tying the AL record after becoming the seventh player in major league history to hit 60 home runs in a season.
SI:AM | Cal Raleigh Hits 60th Homer as Mariners Clinch AL West&
Cal Raleigh hit his MLB-leading 59th homer on Wednesday night, a solo shot for the Seattle Mariners in the first inning against the Colorado Rockies.

A trip around the majors sees Cal Raleigh crush two more bombs and join the very exclusive 60-homer club, the M’s clinch the AL West, the Guardians knock off the Tigers to take the division lead, the Yankees keep rolling in the East, and much more.
titles: Raleigh hits Nos. 59, 60 as M's clinch AL West
SI:AM | Cal Raleigh Hits 60th Homer as Mariners Clinch AL West - Sports Illustrated
Cal Raleigh hits 60th HR, Mariners clinch AL West
Raleigh joins the exclusive 60-homer club and Mariners clinch AL West
summary: Cal Raleigh, playing for the Seattle Mariners, hit his 59th home run of the season, leading the MLB. This homer, achieved during a game against the Colorado Rockies, places him just two short of the American League's single-season record.

European soccer body UEFA moves toward vote to suspend Israel

title: Denmark Reports Systematic Drone Flights by Unknown Actor, Plans Countermeasures
snippets: Defense Minister Troels Lund Poulsen said it appeared a "professional actor" was behind the "systematic" flights, without providing additional details during a news conference Thursday morning.
The goal of the flyovers was to sow fear and division, Danish Minister of Justice Peter Hummelgaard said, adding that the country will seek additional ways to neutralize drones.
titles: Danish officials believe drone flyovers at 4 airports meant to sow fear
Danish officials warn drone flyovers at 4 airports aimed at stoking fear
summary: Danish Defense Minister Troels Lund Poulsen reported systematic drone flights over Denmark by a "professional actor," details of which were not disclosed. Justice Minister Peter Hummelgaard stated the aim was to instill fear and division. Denmark plans to enhance measures to counteract drone activities, as announced in a news conference.

title: Sarkozy Sentenced to 5 Years for Illegal Campaign Financing
snippets: Sarkozy has been handed a five-year prison sentence after trial over finances from late Libyan leader Gaddafi.
Nicolas Sarkozy, former president of France, was found guilty of plotting to finance his 2007 election bid with help from the government of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.
titles: Nicolas Sarkozy found guilty of criminal conspiracy: What we know
Sarkozy Found Guilty of Conspiracy to Seek Libyan Money and Sentenced to Prison
summary: Nicolas Sarkozy, the former French president, was sentenced to five years in prison for his involvement in a scheme to illegally finance his 2007 election campaign with funds from the government of late Libyan leader Muammar el-Qaddafi.

title: Blue Jays' AL East Lead Weakens After 7-1 Loss to Red Sox
snippets: After simulating every MLB game 10,000 times, the SportsLine Projection Model has identified the three best pitcher strikeout props for Thursday's 12-game schedule

Masataka Yoshida knocked in a pair of runs including a solo shot in the fifth inning as Garrett Crochet struck out six batters in a solid eight innings of work to lead the Red Sox to a 7-1 win over the Toronto Blue Jays.
Aaron Judge cranked two homers with four RBIs as Max Fried threw seven innings with seven strikeouts to help the New York Yankees defeat the Chicago White Sox 8-1.

Tanner Bibee pitched six innings picking up five strikeouts and George Valera hit a timely two-run homer as the Cleveland Guardians defeated the Detroit Tigers 5-1 to continue their historic run towards the post-season.
Cal Raleigh hit his major league-leading 59th and 60th home runs of the season and the Seattle Mariners clinched their fourth AL West title with a 9-2 win over the Colorado Rockies.
Athletics catcher Shea Langeliers went 4-for-4 with a home run and a double as Luis Severino hurled 6.1 innings of shutout ball to defeat the Houston Astros 6-0.
Pittsburgh Pirates ace Paul Skenes tossed six innings and collected seven strikeouts before Spencer Horwitz doubled home the go-ahead run in the 11th inning to sink the Cincinnati Reds 4-3.
Danny Jansen cranked a solo shot and Dylan Cease cruised for five innings with eight strikeouts to push the Milwaukee Brewers over the San Diego Padres 3-1.
Matt Shaw homered and had three hits, Michael Busch also went deep and the Chicago Cubs ended a season-high five-game losing streak with a 10-3 win over the New York Mets.
Edmundo Sosa hit three homers as part of a franchise-record eight to lead the Philadelphia Phillies over the Miami Marlins 11-1 and clinch a first-round bye.
titles: Today's best MLB pitcher strikeout props: Back Red Sox starter against Blue Jays
MLB Highlights: Red Sox 7, Blue Jays 1
MLB Highlights: Yankees 8, White Sox 1
MLB Highlights: Guardians 5, Tigers 1
MLB Highlights: Mariners 9, Rockies 2
MLB Highlights: Athletics 6, Astros 0
MLB Highlights: Pirates 4, Reds 3 (11)
MLB Highlights: Brewers 3, Padres 1
MLB Highlights: Cubs 10, Mets 3
MLB Highlights: Phillies 11, Marlins 1
summary: The Toronto Blue Jays' position at the top of the American League East Division was weakened following a 7-1 defeat to the Boston Red Sox. Despite needing a strong performance from Max Scherzer, the Blue Jays were outplayed, with Masataka Yoshida driving in two runs and Garrett Crochet delivering eight solid innings with six strikeouts for the Red Sox.

title: Apple Blames EU's Digital Markets Act for Feature Delays
snippets: Apple is blaming the EU's enforcement of the DMA for delaying the launch of some features in the EU, saying the rules are "leading to a worse experience" for Apple customers in the bloc by exposing them to new risks and reducing choices.
"DMA compliance is not optional, it's an obligation," the EU reminds Apple.
titles: Apple blames EU’s Digital Markets Act for feature delays
Apple demands EU repeal the Digital Markets Act
summary: Apple has attributed delays in launching certain features in the EU to the enforcement of the Digital Markets Act (DMA), claiming it degrades customer experience by increasing risks and limiting choices. The EU has responded by emphasizing that compliance with the DMA is mandatory, not optional.

How much of this hole players will actually see or remember is open to question. Ryder Cup nerves tend to trigger blurry sensations on the 1st tee. That area has been shortened slig
titles: Ryder Cup and the People’s Course
Bethpage Black: hole-by-hole course guide for the 2025 Ryder Cup
summary: The 45th Ryder Cup is being hosted at Bethpage Black, presenting a challenging course with club-tangling rough, narrow fairways, and a tough layout for teams from the USA and Europe. The competition returns with modifications, including a slightly shortened 1st tee area, but the impact of Ryder Cup nerves on players' performance remains a significant factor.

title: One in Three Female Students Face Sexual Harassment at University: Survey
snippets: Women and LGBT students were more likely to report incidents than their male and heterosexual counterparts.

Higher education regulator describes findings from survey of 50,000 final-year students as ‘national scandal’

One in three female students say they have endured sexual harassment during their time at university or college, with most of it taking place around campus, according to data publis
titles: Thousands of students report sexual violence at university
Third of women report facing sexual harassment at university in England, survey finds
summary: A survey of 50,000 final-year students revealed that one in three female students experienced sexual harassment during their time at university or college, primarily around campus. Women and LGBT students reported incidents more frequently than male and heterosexual students. The higher education regulator has labeled the findings a 'national scandal.'

title: Ohio Marks Space Week, Highlights NASA Glenn's Achievements
snippets: Ohio Space Week, Sept. 8–13, highlighted the state’s aerospace legacy and the role NASA’s Glenn Research Center has in advancing space technology.  The week kicked off with the American Astronautical Society’s Glenn Space Technology Symposium, Sept. 8–10, hosted by Case Western Reserve Universi

Led by acting NASA Administrator Sean Duffy, an agency delegation will participate in the International Astronautical Congress (IAC) in Sydney, Australia, from Sunday, Sept. 28 to Friday, Oct. 3. The IAC, organized by the International Astronautical Federation (IAF), is hosted this year by the Space
titles: NASA Glenn Reinforces Role in Aerospace Innovation During Ohio Space Week
NASA Highlights Space Innovation, Exploration at Space Conference
summary: Ohio Space Week, celebrated from Sept. 8-13, underscored Ohio's significant contributions to aerospace, featuring NASA’s Glenn Research Center's advancements in space technology. The week began with the Glenn Space Technology Symposium, hosted by Case Western Reserve University. Furthermore, NASA, led by acting Administrator Sean Duffy, will attend the International Astronautical Congress in Sydney, Australia, from Sept. 28 to Oct. 3, showcasing global space collaboration.
